TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed PolicyLevelType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of a managed code policy level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The highest level of security policy is enterprise-wide. Successive lower levels of hierarchy represent further policy restrictions, but can never grant more permissions than allowed by higher levels. The policy levels in order are the following.
1. Enterprise
2. Machine
3. User
4. Application domain

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.PolicyLevelType AppDomain = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Security policy for all managed code in an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.PolicyLevelType Enterprise = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Security policy for all managed code in an enterprise.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.PolicyLevelType Machine = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Security policy for all managed code that is run on the computer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.PolicyLevelType User = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Security policy for all managed code that is run by the user.
